class.name: LobbyClient
class.brief_description: Node for connecting to the Blazium Lobby service. Offers non-authoritative lobby making features.
class.description: The [LobbyClient] node provides an interface for connecting to the Blazium Lobby service. There is a free instance hosted on the [url=https://blazium.app]blazium.app[/url] domain that is used by default. The normal flow is as follows: 1. Listen to all the signals you are interested in. 2. Connect to the server using [method connect_to_server] method. 3. Call any other methods to create, view or join lobbies, as well as add data to them. 4. Close the session using [method disconnect_from_server] method at the end of the game. [b]Note:[/b] Some methods are non blocking and can be awaited in order to get the result. There are also members on this class that are automatically updated as the lobby gets updated, such as: - [member peer]: The current peer. Reflects changes to the self peer. - [member peers]: The lobby peers. Reflects changes to all peers. - [member lobby]: The lobby. Reflects changes to the lobby. - [member host_data]: The current lobby private data. Only works if you are host. - [member peer_data]: The current peer private data. [codeblocks] [gdscript] func _ready(): disconnected_from_server.connect(_disconnected_from_server) var res : LobbyResult = await connect_to_server().finished if res.has_error(): print(res.error) var res_view: ViewLobbyResult =await create_lobby("Test lobby", false).finished if res_view.has_error(): print(res_view.error) else: print(res_view.lobby.lobby_name) func _disconnected_from_server(reason: String): print("Disconnected from server: " + reason) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: add_lobby_data
method.description: Add data to the lobby. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_lobby_data].

method.name: add_lobby_tags
method.description: Add tags to the lobby. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_tagged].

method.name: add_peer_data
method.description: Add data to a peer. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_data].

method.name: add_peer_user_data
method.description: Add user data to your own peer. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_user_data].

method.name: add_peers_data
method.description: Add data to all peers. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_data].

method.name: connect_to_server
method.description: Connect to a Blazium Lobby Server using the [member game_id] and [member server_url]. Generates [signal connected_to_server] signal if successful.

method.name: create_lobby
method.description: Create a lobby and become host. If you are already in a lobby, you cannot create one. You need to leave first. The new lobby can have a title, tags, max players and password. 0 max players means unlimited. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_created] signal.

method.name: del_lobby_data
method.description: Delete one or more keys from the lobby data. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_lobby_data].

method.name: del_lobby_tags
method.description: Delete one or more keys from the lobby tags. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_tagged].

method.name: del_peer_data
method.description: Delete one or more keys from the peer data. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_data].

method.name: del_peer_user_data
method.description: Delete one or more keys from the peers user data. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_user_data].

method.name: del_peers_data
method.description: Delete one or more keys from the peers data. Only works if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_data].

method.name: disconnect_from_server
method.description: Disconnect from the lobby server. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Generates [signal disconnected_from_server] signal.

method.name: is_host
method.description: Returns true if you are the host of the current lobby.

method.name: join_lobby
method.description: Join a lobby. If you are already in a lobby, you cannot join another one. You need to leave first. If the lobby you want to join is password protected, you need to provide the password. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_joined].

method.name: kick_peer
method.description: Kick a peer. You need to be host to do so. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal peer_left] signal with kicked set to true.

method.name: leave_lobby
method.description: Leave a lobby. You need to be in a lobby to leave one. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_left].

method.name: list_lobbies
method.description: Lists all lobbies. Lobbies that are sealed won't show in the list, except if you disconnected and trying to reconnect to a lobby. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobbies_listed].

method.name: notify_lobby
method.description: Send a notification either to the host, or if you are host send data to all peers. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_notified] signal.

method.name: notify_peer
method.description: Send a notification to a peer, works only if you are host. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_notified] signal.

method.name: quick_join
method.description: Quick join a lobby or create one if none exist. If you are already in a lobby, you cannot join another one. You need to leave first. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates either [signal lobby_joined] or [signal lobby_created].

method.name: send_chat_message
method.description: Send a chat message. Only works if you are in a lobby. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal peer_messaged].

method.name: set_lobby_ready
method.description: Ready up in the lobby. You need to be in a lobby and unready to run this. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal peer_ready].

method.name: set_lobby_sealed
method.description: Seals the lobby. You need to be the host to do this and the lobby needs to be unsealed. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_sealed].

method.name: set_max_players
method.description: Set the max players of the lobby. You need to be the host to do this. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_resized].

method.name: set_password
method.description: Set the password of the lobby. You need to be the host to do this. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_passworded].

method.name: set_title
method.description: Set the title of the lobby. You need to be the host to do this. Needs [method connect_to_server] to be called first. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_titled].

signal.name: connected_to_server
signal.description: Signal generated after you connect to the lobby.

signal.name: disconnected_from_server
signal.description: Signal generated after you disconnect from the lobby.

signal.name: lobbies_listed
signal.description: Signal generated after the lobbies are listed, or when a new lobby is created or removed.

signal.name: lobby_created
signal.description: Signal generated after a lobby is created.

signal.name: lobby_joined
signal.description: Signal generated after you joint a lobby.

signal.name: lobby_left
signal.description: Signal generated after you leave a lobby.

signal.name: lobby_notified
signal.description: Signal generated after a notification is received.

signal.name: lobby_passworded
signal.description: Signal generated after the host changes the lobby password.

signal.name: lobby_resized
signal.description: Signal generated after the host changes the lobby max players.

signal.name: lobby_sealed
signal.description: Signal generated after the host seals the lobby.

signal.name: lobby_tagged
signal.description: Signal generated after the host updated the tags of the lobby

signal.name: lobby_titled
signal.description: Signal generated after the host changes the lobby title.

signal.name: log_updated
signal.description: Signals a log from a command.

signal.name: peer_disconnected
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer disconnects. If they don't reconnect they will be removed.

signal.name: peer_joined
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer joins the lobby.

signal.name: peer_left
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer leaves the lobby.

signal.name: peer_messaged
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer sends a chat message.

signal.name: peer_ready
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer is ready.

signal.name: peer_reconnected
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer reconnects.

signal.name: received_lobby_data
signal.description: Signal generated after data is sent to the lobby.

signal.name: received_peer_data
signal.description: Signal generated after data is sent to peer.

signal.name: received_peer_user_data
signal.description: Signal generated after user data is sent to peer.
